conclusion: To determine if the particle has returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.
The graph shows a particle moving in a straight line.
The particle starts at a velocity of 2 m/s.
The particle experiences a constant velocity of 0 m/s for 1 second.
After 1 second, the particle's velocity changes to -2 m/s.
The particle continues to move with a constant velocity of -2 m/s for 2 seconds.
Finally, the particle moves with a constant velocity of 2 m/s for 1 second.
The particle starts at a position of 0 m.
After 1 second, the particle's position changes to -2 m.
After 2 seconds, the particle's position changes to 0 m.
After 3 seconds, the particle's position changes to 2 m.
The particle does not return to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
